VLIB_weightedHistogram_1D_U16

Functions

int32_t VLIB_weightedHistogram_1D_U16 (const uint16_t *restrict X, const int32_t numX, const int32_t numBins, const uint16_t *restrict binWeight, const uint16_t *restrict histArray, uint16_t *restrict H1, uint16_t *restrict H)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_weightedHistogram_1D_U16 ( const uint16_t *restrict  X,
const int32_t  numX,
const int32_t  numBins,
const uint16_t *restrict  binWeight,
const uint16_t *restrict  histArray,
uint16_t *restrict  H1,
uint16_t *restrict  H 
)

Description
Computes weighted histogram from array of 16-bit unsigned integers using user-specified bins.
Parameters:
[in] *X Input array of scalar (UQ16.0)
[in] numX Number of elements in X (SQ31.0)
[in] numBins Number of bins (SQ31.0)
[in] *binWeight Array of size numX of weight that each element contributes to the histogram (UQ16.0)
[in] *histArray Array for internal use, initialized by VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U16 (UQ16.0)
[in] *H1 Array for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in,out] *H Array to hold the computed histogram (UQ16.0)
Assumptions
  • histArray should be initialized by calling VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U16.
  • H[k] will hold the number of elements that satisfy the following equation:
    • binEdges[k] <= X[i] < binEdges[k+1]
  • The last bin H[end] will hold the number of elements that satisfy the following equation:
    • X[i] == binEdges[end]
  • H, and H1 should be of length numBins, initialized to 0.
  • numX should be a multiple of 2
  • X and binWeight should both be 4 byte aligned
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
